Material used.Description: Human embryonic kidney cells (HEK293E) and human epithelial cancer (HeLa) were maintained at 37°C under humidified conditions and 5% CO2. Cells were grown in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM) and supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS).

Readout description.Molecular Effect: reduced binding of PINK1 to Parkin
Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 mutants Q126P, G309D,23 L347P and W437X were tested for their ability to bind to FLAG-tagged Parkin WT in co-immunoprecipitation experiments. Binding of PINK1 mutants to Parkin was strongly reduced compared to PINK1 WT.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: reduced binding of PINK1 to Parkin

Readout description.Molecular Effect: pathogenic Parkin mutations do not affect binding efficiency
Readout description.Result Description: PD-associated Parkin mutations physically interacted with PINK1 WT similar to Parkin WT.

Biological replicates.Description: short exposures of the respective western blots from four independent experiments were used to assess pixel intensities

Basic positive control.Description: FLAG-Parkin was co-expressed together with PINK1-V5 in HeK293E cells.

Basic negative control.Description: Respective empty vectors were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical significance was assessed by two-tailed paired student’s-t-test.

Material used.Description: HEK293E cells were co-transfected with indicated FLAG-Parkin and PINK1-V5 constructs for 48 h, washed once with PBS and lysed in cold lysis buffer.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: reduced binding of PINK1 to Parkin
Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 mutants Q126P, G309D,23 L347P and W437X were tested for their ability to bind to FLAG-tagged Parkin WT in co-immunoprecipitation experiments. Binding of PINK1 mutants to Parkin was strongly reduced compared to PINK1 WT.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 mutants Q126P, G309D,23 L347P and W437X were tested for their ability to bind to FLAG-tagged Parkin WT in co-immunoprecipitation experiments. Binding of PINK1 mutants to Parkin was strongly reduced compared to PINK1 WT.

Biological replicates.Description: Quantification of (co)-immunoprecipitations was performed by densitrometric analyses using ImageJ software from four independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: FLAG-Parkin was co-expressed together with PINK1-V5 in HeK293E cells.

Basic negative control.Description: Respective empty vectors were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical significance was assessed by two-tailed paired student’s-t-test.
